questions.question_text: When configuring Customizable Forecasting, you can set which of the following Forecast Dates for determining which opportunities contribute to the forecast?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
Using Opportunity Close Date, Product Date, Schedule Date offers greater flexibility than Opportunity Close Date Only does.

No, A is not the correct answer.
When configuring Customizable Forecasting in Salesforce, the correct option is:
E. Opportunity Close Date, Product Date, Schedule Date
This means that the forecast can be determined based on the Opportunity Close Date, the dates associated with each product within an opportunity (Product Date), and potentially the Schedule Date. These options provide flexibility in forecasting based on different aspects of sales opportunities and their related products.
The key here is that Customizable Forecasting in Salesforce allows for a more nuanced approach than just using the Opportunity Close Date. It can incorporate the timing of specific products and schedules associated with the opportunity, giving a more detailed and accurate forecast.
In that case the answer should be all 3 dates? Is that correct?

Select a Forecast Date Type
For most forecast types, you can specify the values that forecasts are based on. To use the opportunity close date and amount or quantity, select Close date. To use dates and total prices or quantities in opportunity products, select Product date. To use dates and revenue amounts or quantities from product schedules, select Schedule date.

choices.E: Opportunity Close Date, Product Date, Schedule Date

discussion.content:

Custom formula fields in Salesforce are recalculated:

A. Nightly

Custom formula fields are generally recalculated as part of the nightly batch processing in Salesforce. This ensures that the data remains up-to-date and accurate for reporting and other purposes.

questions.question_text: What are the opportunity defaults when converting a lead to an opportunity?

discussion.content: A custom lead field may be mapped to Account custom field, Contact custom field, Opportunity custom field. So in total 3

One lead field may have three records.
These three records, can be mapped in three custom fields (Account, Contact and Opportunity).
In Lightning Experience, a custom lead field can map to account, contact, and opportunity fields at the same time.

choices.D: Custom lead fields cannot be mapped
